review: Love the Fire TV!  Loads much faster than my Apple TV even with my ridiculously slow DSL connection.  In fact the Fire TV pops a message periodically that asks if I want to continue watching when the connection is really slow or try again later.  So far, I've chosen "continue" and it apparently has had enough time to spool that it's fine after that.  NOTE:  this is an issue with having a slow internet connection and not an issue with the Fire TV's performance.However, the only flaw I've found was that about 2 weeks after purchase, it wouldn't come on when I pressed the Home button on the remote.  Because it's a computer, I figured, what the heck, guess I'll reboot it.  Pulled the power plug, waited a few seconds and plugged it back in.  The Fire TV fired up and went through it's initialization.  However, pressing any button on the remote still had no effect.  Doh!  Changed the batteries and it worked fine.  So, here's my only gripe...I had originally downloaded and been watching the Netflix app but after I rebooted, I had to download and sign into the app again.  Just be aware that this may happen for you too.I like the interface better than the Apple TV too.  But that's a personal and somewhat subjective thing so your experience may be different.I have not tried any of the other apps yet because I bought it primarily to stream Amazon Prime and Netflix.The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is having to download and sign in to Netflix again on reboot.  If I had a lot of apps and had to do that it would be kind of a pain.
author: Sally Lawrence "Home Sales Sally"
